title: Add Google AdSense script to site <head>

requirements.text: Add the provided Google AdSense loader script tag to the global HTML <head> so it loads for every route/page of the React SPA.

quotes:
to show ads, copy and paste this code between the <head></head> tags on each page of site. <script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js?client=ca-pub-3333682219943646"
     crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

acceptanceCriteria: The following script tag is present inside the <head> of frontend/index.html exactly as provided (including async, src query param client=ca-pub-3333682219943646, and crossorigin="anonymous"): <script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js?client=ca-pub-3333682219943646" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
After building and deploying, viewing page source shows the script tag in the <head> on all routes (e.g., /, /about, /policies, /contact, /join-agent).
No other markup or UI changes are introduced as part of adding the AdSense script.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the backend single-actor architecture; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Configuring or rendering any specific ad units (e.g., <ins class="adsbygoogle"> blocks) within page content.
Adding a cookie consent banner or privacy/terms updates related to ads.
Any changes to routing, navigation, forms, or backend APIs.
